title: UGC revises grant amount for fellowship programmes
description: As per the revised rates, the existing per month fellowship amount for JRF and SRF have been increased from Rs 31,000 and Rs 35,000 to Rs 37,000 and Rs 42,000 respectively. A similar increment has been approved by UGC for junior and senior Savitribai Jyotirao Phule fellowship for single girl child as well. The Dr DS Kothari Post Doctoral Fellowship (DSKPDF) amount for the higher postdoctoral fellowship has been increased to Rs 67,000 per month for the entire tenure from the existing Rs 54,000.

title: Same-sex marriage: Verdict upset my plans, says Dutee Chand
description: In 2019, Dutee came out as lesbian, the first Indian athlete to disclose a same-sex relationship. "I plan to marry my partner Monalisa. But the decision of the apex court has upset all plans. I have been living with Monalisa for five years. We are happy together and as adults, we have every right to make our own decisions. We hope Parliament passes a law allowing same-sex marriages," Dutee said.

title: Right to adopt kids denied, transcouples left in despair
Congress' MP manifesto for caste survey, IPL team
description: Congress on Tuesday released its assembly election manifesto in Bhopal with 1,290 promises spanning a wide spectrum - from caste survey, basic needs and a 27% OBC quota to insurance for all. It promised even to try for an IPL team for the state. "Congress aayegi, khushhaali layegi" is the party's slogan for the 2023 polls. The Padho Padhao Yojana, announced by Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi, is among the key promises.

title: 'Will oust Indian troops from Maldives in 1st week of presidency'
description: Widely seen as a pro-China leader, Muizzu told Al Jazeera in an interview that he will request India to remove its troops on "day one" after taking over as president and that this was one of his top priorities. Muizzu had defeated the incumbent Ibrahim Solih, who was seen as more favourably inclined towards India, in a presidential run off last month.

title: Stars descend on capital as Prez honours best of Indian cinema
description: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday conferred the Dadasaheb Phalke Award, India's highest film honour, on cinema's enduring icon Waheeda Rehman. She also conferred the best actor award on Telugu star Allu Arjun for his performance in 'Pushpa: The Rise' and best actress to Alia Bhatt and Kriti Sanon respectively, for their performances in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and 'Mimi'.

title: Speaker supreme in House, but under us as a poll tribunal: SC
Taj Mahal drowning amid 470 illegal buildings
description: There are 470 illegal structures, including restaurants and cafes, within a 500m radius of the Taj Mahal in Agra. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has lodged FIRs against these encroachments, but local authorities have not taken any action to remove them. ASI officials claim that despite raising the issue multiple times, the encroachments remain. The ASI has the power to issue demolition notices.

title: Fodder scam case: Difficult to cancel Lalu's bail after 4yrs, SC says
description: The Supreme Court has indicated that it would be difficult to cancel the bail granted to RJD chief Lalu Prasad by the Jharkhand High Court in a fodder scam case. The court noted that Lalu Prasad has been out on bail for the past four years. The court also said that even if they were to rule in favor of canceling the bail, it would be challenging to put him back in jail. The case has been postponed until January. The CBI has challenged the high court's order granting bail to Lalu Prasad.

title: Several mega-projects on way for IMEEC: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced plans for the India-Middle East Europe Economic Corridor (IMEEC), which he claims will transform global trade. The corridor will involve several projects, including the development of a mega port, container trans-shipment port, island development, inland waterways, and multi-modal hubs. Modi believes that the corridor will reduce business costs, improve logistics, reduce environmental degradation, and create jobs.

title: RBI slaps record Rs 12 crore fine on ICICI Bank over lapses
description: RBI inspected the books of ICICI Bank in 2020 and 2021 to evaluate its financial status. During the inspection, RBI found that the bank had given loans to companies where two of the lender’s directors held board positions — in violation of RBI guidelines. The bank also marketed and sold non-financial products, which are outside the remit of a commercial bank.

title: SC rules 5-0 against same-sex marriage, 3-2 against adoption
description: Despite asserting that queerness is neither urban nor elite, a bench of Chief Justice DY Chandrachud and Justices SK Kaul, SR Bhat, Hima Kohli and PS Narasimha disappointed the hopeful faces in the courtroom with a unanimous ruling that the right to marry was not a fundamental right and the legislature had the power to regulate it in accordance with societal conditions.

title: Op Ajay: Flight with 286 passengers arrives in Delhi from Israel
description: Another flight carrying 286 passengers, including 18 Nepalese nationals, arrived at Delhi airport from Tel Aviv on Tuesday as part of the government's operation Ajay. This is the fifth flight aimed at assisting Indians who wish to return from Israel due to the conflict with Hamas. The flight faced a technical issue after landing in Tel Aviv on Sunday and was taken to Jordan for repairs.

title: Netherlands stun South Africa in second World Cup upset
description: Netherlands defeated mighty South Africa by 38 runs at the ODI World Cup on Tuesday as the European outsiders humiliated the Proteas for the second time in a year. Chasing 246 to win, South Africa, one of the tournament favourites, were bowled out for 207 in the shadow of the Himalayas. In November last year, the Dutch sent South Africa crashing out of the Twenty20 World Cup in Australia.

title: 3 dead, 1 falls sick in yet another hooch tragedy in dry Bihar
description: Police said, two persons died on Monday in Maksudpur village under Hayaghat block of Darbhanga district while third one breathed his last at the Darbhanga Medical College Hospital (DMCH) in Laheriasarai on Tuesday morning.

title: Pepper X dethrones Caroline Reaper as world's hottest chilli pepper
description: Pepper X, a new pepper created by hot pepper expert Ed Currie, has set a new record on the Scoville scale, being three times hotter than the previous hottest pepper. It rates an average of 2.69 million Scoville Heat Units (SHU), compared to pepper spray at 1.6 million units. Currie developed Pepper X over the course of 10 years and is now protecting it, unlike his previous creation, the Carolina Reaper, which has been used without permission in over 10,000 products.

title: Balasore tragedy: Railways auctions mangled coaches of ill-fated trains
description: The Railways on Tuesday auctioned the mangled coaches of Coromandel Express, Yesvantpur-Howrah Superfast Express and wagons of the goods train, involved in the train mishap near Bahanaga Bazar station in Balasore on June 2 for around Rs 3.8 crore, authorities said.

title: Army moves to induct specialized boats at other water bodies
description: The Indian Army is planning to acquire six fast patrol boats and eight landing craft assault for border areas like Sir Creek and Brahmaputra river basin. They are also seeking 118 integrated surveillance and targeting systems for mechanized forces. This move comes after the Army recently inducted specialized boats for patrolling Pangong Tso in eastern Ladakh. The fast patrol boats should be rugged and versatile, while the landing craft assault should be capable of carrying 35 soldiers. The deadline to respond to the request for information is November 28.

title: 'Can't justify terror': NSA Doval takes on Pak, China
description: NSA Ajit Doval criticized Pakistan for blocking direct land access between India and Central Asia, stating it was self-defeating for Islamabad and hindered regional well-being. Without naming China or Pakistan, Doval emphasized that connectivity initiatives must be transparent, respect sovereignty, and avoid debt burdens. He also offered fully funded capacity building programs to combat terrorism and invited Central Asian countries to utilize India's Chabahar port for maritime trade.

title: Ajit Pawar concedes he met former Pune top cop but did not insist on land transfer
description: Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar on Tuesday responded to claims made in former Pune police commissioner Meeran Borwankar's book, 'Madam Commissioner', acknowledging that he had indeed met with her during his tenure as the district's guardian minister in 2010.

title: PCB files complaint with ICC over Ahmedabad crowd behaviour
description: The Pakistan Cricket Board has filed a complaint with the International Cricket Council regarding alleged boorish crowd behaviour directed at Pakistan's players during their big-ticket match against India in their 2023 ODI World Cup match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on October 14. Pakistan lost the match by seven wickets with 117 balls to spare.

title: 'Congress in many ways a family-run party': Shashi Tharoor
description: When asked about the BJP targeting Congress on dynasty politics at a news conference in Mizoram, Rahul Gandhi tried to counter the question by alleging that the BJP also has its share of dynasts in the party. But the BJP cited Shashi Tharoor statement of Congress being a family-run party to buttress their charge against the grand old party.

title: 'Suicidal': India-origin engineer on working with Sam Bankman-Fried
description: Nishad Singh, a former member of Sam Bankman-Fried's inner circle, testified against him in court, detailing a troubled relationship and his emotional distress leading up to FTX's collapse. Singh claimed he only learned about the company's $8 billion deficit and misuse of customer funds two months before bankruptcy. He accused Bankman-Fried of excessive spending and a disregard for financial responsibility.

title: Pak army nod to move that could send Taliban ties plunging
description: The Pakistan government's decision to deport all illegal immigrants, including over a million Afghans, from the country starting November 1 has received a go-ahead from the all-powerful army.At the 260th Corps Commanders' Conference held at General Headquarters in Rawalpindi, top brass of the Pakistan army resolved to fully support the federal government's decision to repatriate and deport all illegal foreigners from November 1 onwards, the military said in a statement.

title: Amazon rivers fall to lowest in over a century amid Brazil drought
description: The Negro River, a major tributary of the Amazon, has reached its lowest level on record, exacerbating the drought in the Amazon rainforest. The crisis follows a period of intense flooding just two years ago. The low water levels have left boats stranded, isolated remote villages, and caused the deaths of endangered river dolphins. The drought is attributed to the El Nino climate phenomenon and is expected to persist until December. The situation is worsened by soaring temperatures, human-caused fires, and deforestation.

title: Gaza's Osama & ‘Butcher of Khan Younis': Why this Hamas leader is No.1 on Israel's kill-list
description: Israeli air strikes in Gaza have killed a senior Hamas commander, Ayman Nofal, who was in charge of the Central Gaza area. This is the eighth top leader of Hamas to be killed in the ongoing airstrikes. Despite these losses, the leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, remains elusive. Sinwar, dubbed the "Butcher of Khan Younis," is said to be the mastermind behind recent attacks. He is believed to be hiding underground in the tunnels Hamas uses for transportation.

title: Same-sex marriage to adoption rights: Key points from SC verdict
description: The Supreme Court of India has refused to grant legal recognition to same-sex marriage under the Special Marriage Act, stating that it is the responsibility of Parliament to change the law. The court unanimously ruled that there is no fundamental right to marriage for same-sex couples. However, transgender persons in heterosexual relationships have the right to marry under existing laws. The court also delivered a mixed verdict on adoption rights for queer couples. The court stressed the need to eliminate discrimination against the queer community and ensure their access to goods, services, and protection from harassment.

title: How Indians setting up base in critical wealth hubs abroad can help nation
description: Experts believe that more Indians establishing themselves in wealth hubs abroad can have positive implications for India. The primary advantage is an increase in remittances, with India receiving the highest amount globally in 2020.

title: ‘Didn’t your father teach you..?’: Gavaskar asks Marsh, gets quick-witted response
description: After the Australia-Sri Lanka game, Sunil Gavaskar, who is currently engaged in commentary duties for the World Cup, couldn't resist having a playful jab at Mitchell Marsh, invoking his father Geoff Marsh's reputation for a solid defensive batting technique. Gavaskar questioned the all-rounder, asking if his father hadn't taught him to play defensively, given his aggressive batting style.

title: 'Aag thandi ho chuki hai': Ex-spinner to Shoaib Akhtar
description: The Pakistan cricket team received severe backlash from former players for their abject surrender against India in the World Cup match in Ahmedabad. Former Pakistani fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar raised concerns about the team's lack of intensity and determination, which prevented them from quelling the raucous crowd at the Narendra Modi Stadium. Responding to his post, former Pakistan leg spinner Danish Kaneria urged Akhtar to reignite the team's passion and spirit which has completely vanished.

title: 'Dead' for 20 years, ex-navy employee nabbed for triple murder
description: The case traces back to 2004 when Balesh, then 40-year-old, allegedly murdered his brother-in-law, Rajesh, also known as Khushiram, in the Bawana area of Delhi. The motive behind the killing was reportedly a financial dispute, and it was later revealed that Balesh was engaged in an illicit relationship with Rajesh's wife.

title: Scientists to use solar fusion to make moon roads
description: Scientists have conducted experiments on Earth using laser-induced fusion to determine if lunar dust can be used to construct roads and landing pads on the moon. Lunar dust, composed of volcanic rock and dark gray in color, poses hazards to space exploration due to its sharp-edged particles and adhesive properties. By harnessing concentrated sunlight through large lenses, researchers successfully melted lunar dust into solid rock slabs, creating tiles that could interlock to form solid surfaces.

title: 11 workers die in blasts in 2 fireworks units in Tamil Nadu
description: Thirteen workers died in blasts in two fireworks manufacturing units near Sivakasi in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday.

title: Simplified IMPS: What are the new money transfer rules
description: New IMPS system aims to enhance the ease and accuracy of financial transactions. To understand how this revamped IMPS will operate and what happens when you hold multiple accounts within the same bank, here is a comprehensive breakdown of the updated process

title: Bigg Boss Munawar Faruqui: Don't think I'll be able to behave better
description: Stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui has revealed his reasons for participating in Bigg Boss 17, stating that he wanted to do something on television and saw it as an opportunity to connect with his fans. He also discussed his previous experience on a reality show and the advantages of being on Bigg Boss. Faruqui expressed excitement about meeting host Salman Khan and acknowledged the pressure from fans to perform well. He also addressed trolling, stating that it affects him.

title: Xi’s $1 trillion ‘project of the century’ gets reality check
France's Palace of Versailles evacuated again after bomb threat
Gambhir unhappy with India's domination over Pakistan
description: Marked by fierce competition, high emotions, the India-Pakistan cricket rivalry is one of the most intense and storied rivalries in the world of cricket. But India's domination over their arch-rivals in the recent years have made a huge gulf between both the nations. And former opener Gautam Gambhir reckons that India's total supremacy is not good for subcontinental cricket after the hosts handed a seven-wicket mauling to Pakistan in the World Cup match.

title: Assembly polls: Chhattisgarh’s new tribal party names 19 candidates
description: Prominent among the candidate is a former IPS officer Akbar Ram Korram, who had put up a spirited fight as an independent and polled 23,417 votes. However, the ruling Congress had won the by-election.

title: Delhi excise policy: SC reserves verdict on Manish Sisodia's bail pleas
description: A panel of Judges, Sanjiv Khanna and SVN Bhatti, reserved their judgment on two separate bail petitions presented by Sisodia. This came after hearing arguments from his legal counsel, Abhishek Singhvi, and Additional Solicitor General SV Raju, who represented the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED).

title: 69th National Film Awards 2023: Allu Arjun captures 'RRR' winners
description: Telugu actor Allu Arjun created history by becoming the first Tollywood actor to win a National Film Award. At the 69th National Film Awards ceremony, Allu Arjun was seen taking pictures with the winners from his film "RRR." The film received awards for Best Music Direction, Best Choreography, and Best Action Direction. Allu Arjun's achievement has been celebrated in the entertainment industry, and he posed with filmmaker SS Rajamouli to mark their shared success. The awards also honored veteran actress Waheeda Rehman with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.

title: Rohit or Kohli? Ponting feels this star is an ideal captain
description: Australian legend Ricky Ponting holds the view that the relaxed and composed demeanour of Rohit Sharma makes him the perfect choice to captain India in their quest for their third ODI World Cup title, with the potential of securing it on home turf, following their 2011 victory. According to Ponting, Rohit's personality aligns seamlessly with the responsibilities of leading India, enabling Virat Kohli to concentrate on his batting.

title: Why Israel is studying Russia’s mistakes against Ukraine
How to lower high blood pressure without medication
description: Hypertension, often known as high blood pressure, is a common medical condition that, if unchecked, can have dangerous side effects. Changing your lifestyle, including your food and getting regular exercise, can help lower your blood pressure.

title: Alia Bhatt wears her wedding saree as she arrives in Delhi
description: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor attended the National Awards ceremony in Delhi, where Alia received an award for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Alia looked stunning in her wedding saree, while Ranbir looked dapper in a black sherwani. Alia shared her gratitude on Instagram and congratulated Kriti Sanon for her award as well. 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' also starred other notable actors such as Ajay Devgn and Jim Sarbh.

title: 'No one can stop Muslims if...': Khamenei warns Israel
description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei expressed strong sentiments on the conflict in Gaza, stating that Muslims and resistance forces would be unstoppable if Israel's actions persisted. Khamenei declared that individuals in Israeli settlements are armed and not civilians, and called for Israeli officials to face trial for their actions against Palestinians. He insisted that the bombardments in Gaza must stop.

title: Astronauts in space by 2025, PM Modi sets 2035 target for space station, 2040 for Man on Moon
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired a meeting to review the progress of Gaganyaan, India's first human spaceflight mission, and set ambitious goals for the country's space exploration. The meeting discussed plans for tests, including three uncrewed missions of the Human Rated Launch Vehicle. The first demonstration flight of the Crew Escape System is scheduled for October 21.

title: India should aim to send man on moon by 2040: PM Modi
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired a meeting to review the progress of India's Gaganyaan mission, which aims to send a crew of three members into space and bring them back safely. The Department of Space presented an overview of the mission, including technologies developed so far. The meeting also discussed future space exploration goals, including the establishment of an Indian space station by 2035 and sending the first Indian to the moon by 2040.

title: 'Aggressive' Chinese fighter jets spook Canadian plane
description: A Canadian general has criticized the Chinese air force for their aggressive and unsafe behavior towards a Canadian surveillance aircraft off the coast of China. The incident involved a Chinese fighter jet cutting off the patrol plane, dropping flares in its path, and flying within 5 meters of the plane. China filed a diplomatic complaint with Canada over the incident.

title: 'Aapka kaptaan jab dara hua nazar aaye...': Moin criticises Babar
description: Former Pakistan wicketkeeper-batsman Moin Khan didn't mince words in his assessment of Babar Azam's leadership and intent in the ICC World Cup match against India. Openly criticising Babar, Moin branded him a "scared captain" after Pakistan suffered seven-wicket defeat against their arch-rivals on Saturday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

title: 'Aapka kaptaan jab dara hua nazare aaye...': Moin Khan critises Babar Azam
description: Former Pakistan wicketkeeper-batsman Moin Khan didn't mince words in his assessment of Babar Azam's leadership and intent in the ICC World Cup match against India. Openly criticising Babar, Moin branded him a "scared captain" after Pakistan suffered seven-wicket defeat against their arch-rivals on Saturday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

title: Woman feeding stray dogs molested in Mumbai
description: The woman is a home baker and lives with her parents and brother at Borivali. In her complaint to the police, the complainant also stated that she was given threats of gang rape. Police are looking for the accused.

title: HeroMotoCorp, Ultraviolette 'X440' trademark war intensifies
description: Hero MotoCorp recently filed trademarks for the names 'Hurikan' and 'Hurikan 440,' but it is unclear if these will replace the X440.

title: 'Sickened': Billionaire's foundation cuts ties with Harvard
description: The Wexner Foundation has ended its 34-year partnership with Harvard and the Harvard Kennedy School (HKS) due to the university's inadequate response to the Hamas assault on Israel. The foundation expressed disappointment with Harvard President Claudine Gay's "weak and ambiguous" reaction to a letter from over 30 student groups blaming Israel. The foundation had provided significant contributions to HKS and supported 10 fellows each year through its Wexner Israel Fellowship, which aimed to develop Israel's future public leaders. This move follows criticism of Harvard's response to the conflict and the resignation of Israeli billionaires from the Kennedy School's executive board.

title: MG Comet reportedly destroys Toyota Innova HyCross rear
description: A video of an accident involving an MG Comet EV and a Toyota Innova HyCross has gone viral on social media. The rear of the Toyota is severely damaged, while the MG Comet EV remains relatively unscathed.

title: Best economy rate, most wickets: Indian bowlers on song
description: India are top of the standings with six points from three wins in as many matches, having beaten Australia, Afghanistan and Pakistan. But what must be equally heartening for chief coach Rahul Dravid and his staff will be India topping the list of teams who have bowled most economically.

title: Don’t expect bumper rewards & cashbacks on card spends, here's why
description: Banks have scaled back credit card perks, including reward points and cashbacks, during the festive season. The move is aimed at increasing profitability in the loan segment as banks strive to gather deposits after recent interest rate hikes.

title: Same-sex marriage: Key points from Supreme Court verdict
'Please get me out of here': Video of Israeli woman abducted by Hamas
Odisha man missing after boarding flight from UAE
description: A 30-year-old Indian man, Ranjan Swain, has been missing for nearly two months after boarding a flight from Abu Dhabi to India. Ranjan's father filed a complaint with the police, stating that his son was supposed to return on August 17. The family suspects it could be a kidnapping case as they have received phone calls demanding money and threatening to kill Ranjan. The family, along with the police, has been searching for him but there have been no clues so far. Ranjan was the sole breadwinner for his family.

title: 'I am fighter for Allah': ISIS-inspired gunman kills 2 in Brussels
description: Belgian police have launched a citywide manhunt after a gunman, claiming allegiance to ISIS, killed two people in Brussels. The attacker opened fire on a group of Swedish football fans in a taxi near Boulevard d'Ypres, just minutes north of the city's famous Grand Place, ahead of Belgium's Euro 2024 qualifier against Sweden. Disturbing videos captured by bystanders show the assailant on a motorbike stalking and shooting people in public.

title: China-Russia relations: Will Xi Jinping’s gamble on Vladimir Putin pay off?
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Beijing for a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping. The two leaders are expected to discuss their growing economic relationship, as Russia increasingly relies on China for trade and economic support due to Western sanctions. However, there are concerns that China is not benefiting enough from the relationship and that Putin is becoming a burden for Xi.

title: How high command foiled K'taka minister's plan to take 20 Cong MLAs to Mysuru
description: Public works minister Satish Jarkiholi attempted to take 20 Congress MLAs to Mysuru, but the trip was cancelled after intervention from the party high command. AICC general secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala reportedly spoke to Jarkiholi and asked him to cancel the trip, stating that it would send the wrong message and give the opposition a reason to attack the government. Jarkiholi denied any political angle to the trip and said he would plan another one soon with permission from the chief minister and party president. However, sources suggest that Jarkiholi wanted to send a message to the party high command regarding the selection of candidates for Lok Sabha seats.

title: 'Rohit Sharma knew' how to handle Haris Rauf: Wasim Akram
description: Fast bowling legend Wasim Akram slammed Pakistan's lacklustre bowling, especially pacer Haris Rauf, after the 1992 ODI champions suffered an embarrassing seven-wicket loss at the hands of India in their ICC World Cup match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Saturday.

title: Cornell University prof calls Hamas terror attack ‘exhilarating’
description: Russell Rickford, a professor at Cornell University, referred to the Hamas attack on Israel as "exhilarating" and "energizing." He claimed that it shifted the balance of politics and punctured Israel's illusion of invincibility. Rickford argued that recognizing the impact of this shift did not require supporting Hamas. Meanwhile, US President Joe Biden is set to visit Israel amid escalating tensions and a humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title: Kedarnath coldest: Dip in mercury after snow, rain in Ukd
'Help save Palestine, 1 repost =$1': UP cop suspended
description: A police constable in Uttar Pradesh has been suspended for posting a message on Facebook in support of Palestine. Constable Suhail Ansari had sought financial aid for Palestine in his post. After a complaint was filed, an investigation confirmed that the post was shared from Ansari's account, leading to his suspension. Ansari claimed that the post was shared by his minor son while playing a game on his phone.

title: Punjab govt to give ‘martyr’ status to Agniveer
description: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has criticized the Agnipath scheme, which recruits soldiers for a four-year tenure. He argued that soldiers like Agniveer Amritpal Singh, who sacrificed their lives, should not be discriminated against. The Army, however, maintains that the policy guided his treatment. Mann called on the central government to review or shelve the scheme. He handed over a cheque of Rs 1 crore to Singh's family and promised to build a stadium and erect his statue in his honor. The Aam Aadmi Party has also criticized the Agnipath scheme.

title: Nithari case that saw 16 killings: A 17-year trail
Bizman’s guard fires at bus driver on Mum-Pune eway
description: A businessman's bodyguard was arrested after a road rage incident on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. The bodyguard allegedly smashed the windscreen of a bus and fired a bullet at the driver following a near-collision with the businessman's family's BMW. The bodyguard assaulted the bus driver and then fired a shot at him, but the driver managed to escape injury. The bodyguard has been charged with attempted murder and other relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

title: Noida ‘house of horrors’: '...then who killed our kids?'
description: The parents of a missing girl who was later identified as a victim of the Nithari killings are devastated by the news of the acquittal of Surinder Koli, the main accused in the case. The father had sold land to hire lawyers and fight for justice, and now feels that all their hopes have been dashed. Another man whose son went missing in Nithari in 2006 also expressed his anger towards the police for failing to trace his child.

title: 10-year-old raped in MP; suspect a 19-year-old
Instagram friends blackmail class 9 girl with nude videos
description: A 13-year-old girl in Morbi, India, was blackmailed and extorted after befriending unknown people on Instagram. The girl accepted a friend request from a woman named Mittal Solanki, who introduced her to a boy named Kishan Patel. Patel then tried to molest her and blackmailed her with a selfie he took without her consent. He forced her to undress and recorded the act. Patel demanded money from her, threatening to circulate the videos on social media. The girl's mother reported the incident, leading to Patel's arrest. Solanki is still at large.

title: Isro chief meets chess grandmaster Pragg
description: ISRO chairman S Somanath met chess grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa in Chennai and expressed his belief that Praggnanandhaa will inspire young people in the field of science and technology. Somanath praised Praggnanandhaa's achievements and compared them to India's lunar mission. He also mentioned the upcoming maiden test flight of the Gaganyaan programme on October 21 and the progress of the Aditya-L1 mission, which is expected to reach its destination in January.

title: India, UK hold first '2+2' ahead of possible Sunak visit
description: India and the United Kingdom held their inaugural '2+2' foreign and defence dialogue on Monday, ahead of a possible visit by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak later this month, looking to ramp up defence, security and trade ties.
